Anish S. Shah is a physician and scientist, a dog-dad, and husband. He can be found hiking, climbing, and troubleshooting code over coffee.

## Timeline

1. Currently at the [University of Utah](https://medicine.utah.edu/internal-medicine/cardiovascular-medicine) as a fellow in cardiac electrophysiology (*2024* -- *2026*)
1. Clinical and research training as a cardiology fellow at the [University of Illinois at Chicago](https://chicago.medicine.uic.edu/departments/academic-departments/medicine/cardiology/education/fellowship-program/), supported by an NIH-F32 award. Primary mentor: [Dr. Dawood Darbar](https://chicago.medicine.uic.edu/medicine/profiles/darbar-dawood/) (*2020* -- *2024*)
1. During a NIH-TL1 award, completed a [master's degree](https://med.emory.edu/departments/biomedical-informatics/education/masters.html) at Emory University. Primary mentor: [Dr. Amit J. Shah](https://med.emory.edu/directory/profile/?u=AJSHAH3) (*2019* -- *2021*)
1. Clinical training as a resident physician at the [J. Willis Hurst Internal Medicine Residency](https://med.emory.edu/departments/medicine/education/residency-program/index.html) program at Emory University (*2016* -- *2019*)
1. [Doctorate in medicine](https://medicine.tamu.edu) at Texas A&M University (*2012* -- *2016*)
1. [Baccalaureate in linguistics](http://linguistics.emory.edu/home/) and behavioral neuroscience at Emory University (*2007* -- *2011*)

## Academic Interests

- Stress and arrhythmogenesis
- Signal processing and machine learning
- Medical history and medical education
- Information theory
